channel.title: NEED HELP PORTFORWARDING - Want a challenge? Try to solve this... (WINDOWS 7)
channel.description:
Hi it's me again.
I need help on the hardest part. Port forwarding. Dun dun dun....
Mkay uTorrent sometimes works sometimes doesn't but I never got it to work on 43594 [u][b] EDIT: THIS IS SO FRUSTRATING ALL PORTS APPEAR OPEN EXCEPT 43594
ALSO PLEASE NOTE I'M USING WINDOWS 7 HOME PREMIEM x64 bit[/b][/u]
portforward.com i have tried and none of the below guides/configs work.
[img]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Roboticopperatingbuddy/op2.png[/img] [img]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Roboticopperatingbuddy/op1.png[/img]
On the runescape private server guide says to forward my port to 43594 I have to make it look like what it looks like on their page then add my private IP and click apply when I've done so it says settings saved but nothing happens...
[img]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Roboticopperatingbuddy/varbs.png[/img]
I Use D-Link 624 router.
Their port checker software says the port isn't open. And I try to login anyway but no luck. I can play privately with IP 127.0.0.1 but when I use my IP lonescape.servegame.com it sometimes says no response from server or Error connecting to server.
Please help me I have been putting as much effort into this as I can and I can't get this step right. :(

item.title: NEED HELP PORTFORWARDING - Want a challenge? Try to solve this... (WINDOWS 7)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

Hmm okay I’ll start a static

Also I run a wireless network, the computer I use isn’t the one with the router but the computer is connected to the router through the network…

Do I have to go to the computer that is connected to the router directly for all this stuff to work? Or will it work anyway?

Read full topic

@Jonnydpickle wrote:

Yes sir you need a static IP or it refreshes itself everytime you restart your computer or browser forget which

@Mod_Hidden wrote:

mangalover51:

dude… i just told you… not hard to solve

I am using windows 7 like him. I did it the very exact same way I did. It won’t work for him because he has a different internet provider than I do. I portforwarded on my first try. His problem is different than what you think so please don’t say its not hard to solve. Its rude trying to be smart when your doing it all wrong and thinking it all wrong.

item.title: NEED HELP PORTFORWARDING - Want a challenge? Try to solve this... (WINDOWS 7)
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Hidden Mod Hidden
item.description:
@Mod_Hidden wrote:

Yes you can use any #### ports as long as they are not taken up. For ex. 43392 I doubt your computer is using it but it would work yah.

Good luck and hopfully you will get your annoying router to work.

Read full topic
item.source: NEED HELP PORTFORWARDING - Want a challenge? Try to solve this... (WINDOWS 7)

item.title: NEED HELP PORTFORWARDING - Want a challenge? Try to solve this... (WINDOWS 7)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

Mod Hidden:

Guys I just tried I did in correctly. I portforwarded over many computers for people. Something is wrong with his router. His provider might be locking or won’t allow that port I don’t know. I helped him over teamviewer.

I would like to thank Mod Hidden and all of you for trying to help me as best as you could. But I leave with one last question. Is there a way to run a server without opening port 43594? Just use another like 23497 or something. I has to be possible because I’ve seen people do it.

Read full topic

item.source: NEED HELP PORTFORWARDING - Want a challenge? Try to solve this... (WINDOWS 7)

item.title: NEED HELP PORTFORWARDING - Want a challenge? Try to solve this... (WINDOWS 7)
item.dc:creator: @mangalover51 mangalover51
item.description:
@mangalover51 wrote:

it’s this…

you put your local ip in there… heres a little tut

click start on your computer… click run…type cmd…type ipconfig in the black box that pops up when you type cmd… and type the numbers it gives you next to :: ‘ip address’ put in that box that says private ip…

if you have vista it’s just open start then type in cmd and press enter… then same thing in the black box type in ipconfig and type in the ‘ip address’ it shows next to that…

and it should work…

idk tut for windows 7 haven’t worked with that yet…

Read full topic
